--000000000000c69ffa056d547364
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"

Hi all,

I've begun reproducing the DeepNeuroevolution paper in Pytorch. I've
considered only the Atari case study to test my algorithm on.
In the paper, it's mentioned that "During training, each agent is evaluated
on a full episode (capped at 20k frames), which can include multiple lives
and fitness is the final episode reward". Thus I think that I need to track
the number of frames each agent is proceeding and limit its evaluation at
20k frames ( 5k frames for my case since I'm doing k=4 frame skipping
technique for some games).

I was wondering if anyone could tell me which environment Uber was wrapping
( -v0 or -v4, doing frame skipping or not) and also for the reward, are
they just picking the last reward as the fitness score or calculating the
accumulated reward or doing some reward clipping.

Thank you,

--000000000000c69ffa056d547364
Content-Type: text/html; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
